page.title: 01THE VILLAGE OF BICKLEIGH
page.content: Bickleigh, population 200, is a pleasant village on a busy road which twists across a picturesque stone bridge creating a scene attractive enough to be found on chocolate boxes and suitable for jigsaw puzzles. Sur- rounded by rolling hills and far views of green and pleasant countryside, it is small wonder that the inhabitants feel very privileged, and that the area is visited by thousands of holidaymakers and tourists who wish to be refreshed by contact with a Britain long disappeared from{their}daily lives. The inhabitants enjoy a quiet rural pace with a strong sense of community. Many are farmers with long traditions and a great pride in possession.
